column4: witch desktop has less cpu and mem usage,  i tried xfce, but it's still slow sometimes
i recommend fluxbox but thats cos i use it
try both, see whch you prefer
sudo apt-get install fluxbox then logoff and change session type
tryed fluxbox, it runs smothly , is there a multi-ui? cuz mine is in chinese
so its chinese now or you'd like chinese?
then you changed your hostname in /etc/hostname but not in /etc/hosts    so you will need to use root recovery mode to get ustuck
how do i get to root recovery mode
hold shift at boot, select recovery mode, select root
you can mount the partition and chroot, or if you are file editting you can do it without chroot
the file is generated by grub, I suggest you boot to liveCD, chroot to the installed OS and fix
or show you the motherboard make / model so you can maybe find out. You can always go into the BIOS
